data.title: Not good
data.text: The bar was dirty and we stopped early afternoon.  Instead of cleaning the gum off the floor the bar tender was on her cell phone. There were no limes for the drinks. The beer on tap was so carbonated that the tender couldn't serve us beer.

data.title: Great Little Bar!
data.text:
I've been to the Irish Wolf many times over the years (even when it used to be called "the Judge and Jury") - and I've always had a great time and felt "at home." The bartenders have always been extremely friendly and professional  - they'll even remember your drink of choice after a couple of visits! The drinks are reasonably priced and well made - and there's a variety of music that would appeal to several generations. (I haven't had the food, so I don't have an opinion there.) 

If you're lucky and catch him in, the owner's Irish Brogue will fondly remind you of the country from which the pub gets its name. You won't be disappointed if you give this bar a shot.

data.title: 2 drink minimum
data.text: They have a cover charge, and a 2 drink minimum, only it isn't a nightclub, its a dingy little hole in the wall. owner and bartenders are rude, as soon as I set my drink on the bar they throw it out even though the cup was not empty. worst service out of any bar in downtown Scranton, and there are many more to choose from.
